channel.title: BBC News - UK Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Boris Johnson will not isolate after Covid case among staff
item.description: No 10 says he was not in close contact with a staffer who tested positive during a visit to Scotland.

item.title: COP26: Alok Sharma criticised for international - and quarantine-free - travel
item.description: Alok Sharma visited more than 30 countries to set up climate conference - and didn't quarantine.

item.title: No apology from Boris Johnson over Thatcher coal mine closures remark
item.description: But No 10 says Boris Johnson recognises the pain of closures, after he said they helped the climate.

item.title: PM's coal mining 'joke' no laughing matter, say MPs
item.description: Boris Johnson said that closing mines had given the UK an early start fighting climate change.

item.title: COP26: How serious is the government about climate conference?
item.description: With less than 90 days to go to Glasgow climate summit, there is uncertainty surrounding the event.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer: Labour should be proud of Tony Blair's record
item.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer vows turn the party "inside out" to win the next general election.

item.title: Geronimo: Minister urged not to allow 'healthy' alpaca's death
item.description: More than 80,000 people sign a petition to save Geronimo whose owner denies the alpaca has TB.

item.title: Keeping old computers going costs government £2.3bn a year, says report
item.description: Just under half the entire IT budget goes on patching up outdated systems, a government report says.

item.title: Covid: Live events to be protected by £750m government-backed insurance scheme
item.description: Music festivals are among the events in the UK that will be protected if they are forced to cancel.

item.title: New oil development off Shetland should not go ahead - Starmer
item.description: The Labour leader says it would send the wrong signal for the Cambo oil field to be approved ahead of COP26.

item.title: Conservative donors have no influence on policy, insists Grant Shapps
item.description: Grant Shapps defends big donors getting access to Boris Johnson and Rishi Sunak.

item.title: Paul Embery: Pro-Brexit fire union official unfairly sacked, tribunal finds
item.description: A tribunal finds Paul Embery was subject to a "witch hunt" after appearing at a Leave Means Leave rally.

item.title: Channel crossings: Hundreds more migrants reach UK after record day
item.description: According to Home Office figures, there have now been 10,711 arrivals in 449 boats so far in 2021.

item.title: Government accused of 'burying' conversion therapy report
item.description: Boris Johnson vowed to ban the "abhorrent" practice - but an official report on it has yet to appear.

item.title: Sturgeon: Strange the PM will not meet me
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon says she does not feel snubbed but it is odd not to meet PM on his Scotland visit.

item.title: Marcus Rashford: Poor families missing out on food vouchers
item.description: The footballer says health professionals need to do more to raise awareness about the NHS scheme.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM and transport secretary defend travel changes
item.description: British tourists in Mexico who are due back after Sunday's deadline will need to decide whether to come home early to avoid quarantining.

item.title: Keir Starmer attacks government record on green jobs
item.description: The Labour leader says there is a "chasm between soundbites and action" on climate-friendly employment.

item.title: MP Maria Miller wants AI 'nudifying' tool banned
item.description: A website that allows people to undress a photograph in seconds is gaining lots of users.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'not in favour' of drug consumption rooms
item.description: The Scottish government is committed to setting up "safe" consumption facilities - but the prime minister opposes them.

item.title: Covid travel: France moves to amber list and green list expands
item.description: Up to 6,000 Britons are currently in Mexico, which is moving to the red list, Grant Shapps says.

item.title: Tories face questions over co-chair's firm marketing Covid tests to rich clients
item.description: The Conservatives say Ben Elliot's business activities are separate from the party after Labour criticism.

item.title: Ministers reject calls to lower state pension age to 60
item.description: The government says lowering the state pension age is not fair or affordable for taxpayers.

item.title: Covid vaccine set to be offered to 16 and 17-year-olds
item.description: More than one million teenagers would be included in a new rollout if ministers accept expert advice.

item.title: Rishi Sunak warns young home working may hurt their career
item.description: The chancellor says being in the office helped him build strong relationships when he started out.

item.title: Drug deaths in England and Wales highest since 1993
item.description: In total, 4,561 deaths related to drug poisoning were registered in England and Wales last year.

item.title: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya: Belarus opposition leader hopeful after Boris Johnson meeting
item.description: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya says she has been assured of further UK support, amid a crackdown on dissent.

item.title: Shops and schools proposed for council election pilots in Wales
item.description: Could voting with your weekly shop boost turnout at next year's council elections?

item.title: Carrie Johnson and Boris Johnson expecting second child
item.description: The couple are expecting a second child, months after a miscarriage left Carrie "heartbroken".

item.title: Labour: Tories must come clean over elite donors
item.description: Newspaper reports say party donors were given access to the PM and chancellor for their contributions.

item.title: Humza Yousaf reports nursery over discrimination fears
item.description: Health Secretary Humza Yousaf says his daughter was twice refused a place at the nursery, which denies any discrimination.

item.title: UK and Iran summon diplomats after tanker attack
item.description: Two people were killed in the attack on an oil tanker, which the UK, US and Israel blame on Iran.

item.title: NHS Covid-19 app in England and Wales tweaked to notify fewer contacts
item.description: The app in England and Wales will now only alert contacts from the previous two days in asymptomatic cases.

item.title: Pingdemic: ‘I'm losing hundreds of pounds in tips’
item.description: An ill-timed alert on the NHS Covid app can mean bar staff losing out on tip income at the weekend.

item.title: Covid-19: First people arriving into UK after rules relaxed for fully jabbed
item.description: People vaccinated in the EU or US do not need to isolate when coming to the UK from an amber country.

item.title: End self-isolation for double-jabbed sooner, says Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: Labour is calling on Boris Johnson to bring England in to line with Wales on quarantine measures.

item.title: NHS pay: Call for privately employed staff to get increase
item.description: Cleaners and others employed by contractors should receive the same rise as NHS staff, a union says.

item.title: Apsana Begum: Labour MP cleared of fraudulent housing claims
item.description: Apsana Begum says the trial caused her "great distress" and damaged her reputation.

item.title: UK military opens first space command centre
item.description: The new operations centre will help the UK maintain a "battle-winning advantage", ministers say.

item.title: Migrant women and babies held in shocking conditions, MPs find
item.description: A group of MPs describes scenes at a Dover asylum unit as "wholly inappropriate" and a Covid risk.

item.title: Prof Chris Whitty: Man sentenced for St James's Park assault
item.description: Lewis Hughes says he lost his job after assaulting England's chief medical officer in central London.

item.title: RNLI donations increase after migrant rescue criticism
item.description: The lifeboat charity says it has been "overwhelmed" by support after it released footage of Channel rescues.

item.title: Holocaust memorial outside Parliament to go ahead
item.description: Fears have been raised that the site could become a terrorist target, but ministers say it will be safe.

item.title: David Greenhalgh death: Tributes paid to Bolton Council leader
item.description: David Greenhalgh became the first Tory leader of Bolton Council in four decades.

item.title: Drug deaths in Scotland reach new record level
item.description: The country continues to have the worst drug death rate in Europe, with a further 1,339 people dying last year.

item.title: Walking and biking prioritised in new Highway Code
item.description: Greater priority for pedestrians at crossings and for cyclists at junctions are among the changes.

item.title: Global summit raises $4bn for schools despite aid row
item.description: World leaders pledge to get more children into school in the world's poorest countries.

item.title: NHS Covid-19 app pings rise by over 70,000 to new record
item.description: The number of coronavirus alerts hits a new record, with nearly 690,000 sent in England and Wales.

item.title: Dead Ringers impressionists on how Covid changed their work
item.description: Impressionists Jon Culshaw, Jan Ravens and Debra Stephenson on their ever-changing political material.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Thatcher remarks disgusting, says former miner
item.description: A former miner has said Boris Johnson's comments on Margaret Thatcher's mine closures are "disgusting".

item.title: Christine Jardine: Government 'making up a rule' to suit itself
item.description: Liberal Democrat Christine Jardine says the government is "making up a rule" on quarantine to suit its ministers.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer: 'Shetland oil field should be blocked'
item.description: The Labour leader says approval should not be given for a new oil and gas development west of Shetland.

item.title: PM says the UK is working together 'at all levels'
item.description: Boris Johnson says he is not snubbing the Scottish government by not holding talks on his visit to Scotland.

item.title: Boris Johnson: Why mining gaffe will linger after Scottish visit
item.description: Boris Johnson put his foot in it by joking that Margaret Thatcher gave the UK a "big early start" in the shift away from coal.

item.title: Riots 10 years on: The five summer nights when London burned
item.description: In August 2011 a man was shot dead by police in London, triggering the worst civil unrest in decades.

item.title: Ben Elliot: Conservative Party money man with A-list connections
item.description: Tory fundraiser and co-chairman Ben Elliot is at the centre of controversy over an elite donors club.

item.title: Indyref2: Why has the campaign for another vote gone quiet?
item.description: Boris Johnson visits Scotland with no sign an independence referendum will be soon, writes Nick Eardley.

item.title: Covid-19: Behind-the-scenes battles over amber watchlist
item.description: Cabinet divisions over international travel rules spilled out into the open this week, writes Adam Fleming.

item.title: Tragedy became Sliding Doors moment for politician
item.description: Julie James's life changed overnight when the father of her first child was killed in a car crash.

item.title: Guli Francis-Dehqani: The bishop tackling England's housing crisis
item.description: The Church of England owns a lot of land - Guli Francis-Dehqani wants to use it for the common good.

item.title: Official Secrets Act: Do government plans threaten investigative journalism?
item.description: Campaigners and reporters say planned changes to the Official Secrets Act threaten press freedoms.

item.title: Zimbabwean with football dreams to be kicked out of UK
item.description: Christopher Arundell grew up in the UK but after doing time in jail is being deported to Zimbabwe.

item.title: What happens to British ships when satellites don't work?
item.description: The Royal Navy and merchant fleet have no back-up if navigation systems are disrupted, experts warn.

item.title: Boris Johnson's police numbers claim fact-checked
item.description: A look at the prime minister's claims about crime statistics, police numbers and funding.

item.title: John Stonehouse: Bizarre tale of the MP who faked his own death
item.description: Was John Stonehouse a spy who betrayed his country? Or a naive and broken man? James Naughtie investigates.

item.title: Brexit: What's the Northern Ireland Protocol?
item.description: Urgent changes to the post-Brexit Northern Ireland Protocol have been called for by the UK government.

item.title: Cummings: Eight takeaways from his interview
item.description: The PM's former chief adviser on lockdowns, Downing Street rows, Brexit and coup discussions.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.
